titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Harrisonburg-Rockingham Historical Society Collection, 1740-1950
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
Special Collections SC 0117
titlepage.publisher: Special Collections, Carrier Library, James Madison University

defitem.label: Processed by:
defitem.item: Sandra Joyner and Don Lambert, April 1987; Cara Lundgren, 2014

did.abstract: This collection consists of approximately 1,700 items, in six boxes and one flat folder, and covers the dates 1740-1950. The collection is comprised of a very wide variety of legal, governmental, business, school, and church records, as well as personal papers, all primarily from the Central Shenandoah Valley (Rockingham, Shenandoah, Augusta, and Page counties). Most are originals, but some facsimiles are included.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection. Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the James Madison University Special Collections Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to the James Madison University Special Collections Library. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library Reference Desk (library-special@jmu.edu).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], [box #, folder #], Harrisonburg-Rockingham Historical Society Collection, 1740-1950, SC 0117, Special Collections, Carrier Library, James Madison University, Harrisonburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was compiled from many boxes of miscellaneous papers placed on deposit at the library by the Harrisonburg-Rockingham Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: In order to streamline the process of applying collection numbers, Special Collections staff completed a large-scale renumbering campaign in the spring of 2017. This collection was previously cataloged as SC 2095.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of approximately 1,700 items, in six boxes and one flat folder, and covers the dates 1740-1950. The collection is comprised of a very wide variety of legal, governmental, business, school, and church records, as well as personal papers, all primarily from the Central Shenandoah Valley (Rockingham, Shenandoah, Augusta, and Page Counties). Most are originals, but some photocopies are included.

The Legal/Governmental Documents Series includes summonses, road documents, juror lists, delivery bonds, papers from the Sheriff's Office and the Circuit Courts of Rockingham and Shenandoah Counties, CSA Telegraph Reports, postal accounts, and miscellaneous other official reports, claims, applications, etc.

The Business/Institutional Documents Series includes church histories and other church documents, school catalogs, slave purchase documents, records of Cootes' Store, and other miscellaneous business papers which are not related to families, such as the merger of the News Register Co. and Rockingham Publishing Co. Significantly the collection includes a complete issue of the Rockingham Weekly Register from April 26, 1828, that is not extant elsewhere.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Most of the papers were received in no order. A few packets were labeled with family names. Documents are arranged chronologically within folders, except in the Miscellaneous folders of the Individual/Family series, where they are filed alphabetically. The documents were sorted into the following series and sub series:

did.unittitle: Account book, J. H. Shue, Clerk of Circuit Ct. (1 item), 1875-1881
Applications to create voting precincts (2 items), 1875-1881
Articles of agreement, 1861 Militia draft substitute agreement (11 items), 1821-1894
Complaints of illegal sales of poison (14 items), 1906-1907
Court Actions: court decisions and grand jury presentments (7 items), 1779-1897
Courthouse and Public Square; papers dealing with the building of a new courthouse (12 items), 1832-1838
CSA Military telegraph reports, Confederate Bonds (5 items), 1864
Jail: Reports on the condition of the jail (3 items), 1824-1916
Juror lists. See also Oversize Series (63 items), 1871-1902
Lawsuit: Haga vs. Bradley; Article of agreement and depositions concerning this lawsuit (13 items), 1829-1835
Licenses; To sell merchandise, keep private entertainment, practice as physician or attorney, operate as daguerrian artist, 1929 list of stills (53 items), 1760-1929
Assessments of Clerks of the Court (93 items), 1880-1914
Receipts & applications for business charters (51 items), 1875-1903
Recognizance bonds, promises to keep the peace (77 items), 1890-1897
Road documents. See also Oversize Series (57 items), 1793-1927
Tax Data. See also Oversize Series (4 items), 1801-1861
Miscellaneous legal documents: Claims, judgments of court, deposition notice, program from dedication ceremony of W. G. Myers Armory (6 items), 1797-1954
C&W Railroad Company. See also Oversize Series (3 items), 1895
Currency: Bills issued from banks and counties (2 items), 1860-1861
Gilbert, Felix. Extracts by Warren Skidmore from Account book, 1768-1769
Rawley Springs Tonic Water Co., Rawley Springs Turnpike Co. (4 items), 1890, 1896
Telephone companies: Receipts from Harrisonburg Mutual Telephone Co.; by-laws of Page Co. Telephone Company (3 items), 1902-1904

General Church documents: Contains undated typed manuscript "Some Old Churches of Rockingham& Neighboring Counties" by Ruebush & Wayland; M. E. Church S., Rockingham Dist. Steward's Bk. 1884; 1911 Rockingham Sunday School Association Constitution; [Peaked Mountain Church] list, 1920 (4 items), 1884-1920, undated

Church histories and directories, Cook's Creek Presbyterian, Hebrew Friendship congregation, Methodist Church of Dayton, Mt. Hebron, Port Republic Methodist Church, New St. Stephen's Reformed Church, Trissels Mennonite Congregation, 1927-1952

School documents: Catalogs from Girls' Home School, Prospectus for Industrial School at Massanetta Springs, Program from McGaheysville H. S., Teacher's District Meeting, Timberville, 1908 program (5 items), 1889-1926
Mossy Creek Academy: Lists of subscribers, Constitution (with transcription) (5 items), 1850

Miscellaneous business documents; 1901 timber contract; 1816 & other sale notices; 1843 Elk Run tent holders agreement; subscription form, Golden Horseshoe Tavern, Elkton; 1855 Rockingham Mutual Fire Ins. Co. policy for A. Sprinkel; 1913 (?) merger of News Register Co. & Rockingham Pub. Co., Account with J.P. Houck; Minute book of Weyers Cave Telephone Exchange, 1898-1952; Receipts of P.H. Myers (29 items), 1816-1919

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Separate folders under each family or individual for which 5 or more relevant items are held.

did.unittitle: Basford, Thomas. Includes summonses, tax data, and business accounts (8 items), 1868-1874
Conrad, Edward. Contains deeds & plat for downtown Harrisonburg; other deeds; & receipt for Valley Telephone Co. shares. See also Oversize (12 items), 1895-1908
Crawford, William. Contains tax information (13 items), 1867-1877
Eversole Family. Contains letters; road tax toll; RR stock receipts; & misc (70 items), 1832-1879
Garber Family. Includes tax data, muster fines, tax paper for the Confederacy, and receipts from shares of stock (5 items), 1834-1886
Gibbons Family. Contains letters written by Mary Gibbons, including one dated 20 June 1862 describing battles of Pt. Republic & Cross Keys (17 items), 1838-1895
Harrison Family. Includes an indenture that transferred land from T. Harrison to Rockingham County for a courthouse (3 items), 1779-1831
Kemper Family. Letters, mostly written to Fanny Kemper before Civil War (34 items), 1843-1862
Kite, Joseph H. Bankruptcy papers (30 items), 1873-1875
Koontz, John. Includes 1812 grant to land where Koontz built the house later occupied by Lincoln's. See also Oversize Series (24 items), 1805-1832
Lincoln Family. Includes land indentures and typescript of genealogy. See also Oversize Series (6 items), 1780-1831
Martz Family. Business letters from E. R. Shue, F. H. Bowman, etc. and letter to Hiram Martz commenting on politics and the recent elections (34 items), 1840-1914

McGahey Family. Letters, deed, survey, & appraisal of estate of Tobias R. McGahey, 1845; blacksmithing accounts; 1862 note from John Letcher; 1884 note from J. R. Jones; churn patents, & misc (45 items), 1809-1944
Nicholas Family. See also Oversize Series (5 items), 1839-1843
Roller, John Edwin. Letters; description of military drill; tax receipts & other business papers (55 items), 1846-1908
Showalter, Jacob. Includes 1840 indenture of John Showalter; other docs. relevant to estate of Jacob (31 items), 1826-1876
Shue, J. H. 3 Confederate bills; docs. relating to Shue estate (15 items), 1864-1886
Spader, John, and relatives. Deeds, loan bonds (ca. 12 items), 1866-1917
Winfield Family. Includes many documents relating to the Civil War, business documents, indenture for servitude of a free boy of color (37 items), 1823-1944

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Combined folders in one alphabetical sequence for four or less documents per name. See Cross Index for names.

did.unittitle: Assessments of clerks of the Court (8 items), 1880-1914
Reports of business of the Courts (35 items), 1883-1914
Miscellaneous legal documents: Juror list, list of Rockingham county officers; lists of county pensioners 1920, '21 (5 items), 1874-1921
Chesapeake & Western Railroad Company: complete issue of Rockingham Weekly Register, April 28, 1828
Chesapeake & Western Railroad Company: 1 page from Bridgewater Herald, September 14, 1895
S-Z (several large items in map drawer including a March 19, 1777 deed between Michael Bowyer and Sebastian March in Augusta County, in the Colony of Virginia.)
Conrad Family land grants and indentures
Plat of Hall lands, Harrisonburg (1 item), 1883
